muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    Usage

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>                n_1       n_2       n_3       n_4       n_5      n_6       n_7
#> sample_1  4.166095 12.037247  6.085363 2.6563090 3.1691288 4.915372  2.920025
#> sample_2  7.883685  1.223627  3.833845 6.8824976 5.1459346 4.609365  1.556665
#> sample_3  8.280471  2.509928 20.940352 7.0166518 4.8805205 7.655636  1.926578
#> sample_4  4.003927  1.253769  5.532046 1.3992844 0.6164648 4.850395 16.538737
#> sample_5 11.190175  5.696480  8.995401 0.1969287 3.6608703 1.868779  2.286657
#>                n_8       n_9      n_10
#> sample_1  1.348031  5.026987  9.038634
#> sample_2 23.126373  2.624527 11.981081
#> sample_3  2.922368 10.300824  3.541033
#> sample_4  2.964206  8.543546 10.526050
#> sample_5  5.807364  2.840043  4.665203
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
